info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 3:41PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Jackson and central Haywood Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 341 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waynesville, or near Lake Junaluska, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesville, Lake Junaluska, Clyde, Maggie Valley, B.R. Parkway-Smoky Mountains To Balsam Gap, Smoky Mountains-Cataloochee, Balsam, B.R. Parkway-Balsam Gap To Black Balsam Area, Cherokee and Cove Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
